info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 6:29PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 629 PM MST, temperatures are now falling to near or below freezing across the higher terrain. With earlier rain and snow showers, icy conditions will be possible this evening over the higher terrain.
Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Show Low, Forest Lakes, Williams, Lakeview, Starlight Pines, Mormon Lake, Clints Well, and Stoneman Lake
This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 157 and 207. Interstate 17 between mile markers 314 and 339. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 436. Highway 180 between mile markers 217 and 255.
info.instruction: A drop in temperatures will lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.

parameter.value: AREAS OF BLACK ICE POSSIBLE ABOVE 6500 FEET UNTIL 9 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Western Mogollon Rim; Eastern Mogollon Rim
